Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.name: Pepper Bell: Bacterial Spot
Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial spot is caused by *Xanthomonas campestris pv. vesicatoria*. It appears as small, irregular, dark brown or black spots on leaves and fruits.
prevention: Remove and destroy infected plant debris.

Pepper__bell___healthy.name: Pepper Bell: Healthy
Pepper__bell___healthy.description: The plant appears healthy with no visible signs of disease.

Potato___Early_blight.name: Potato: Early Blight
Potato___Early_blight.description: Caused by the fungus *Alternaria solani*, characterized by concentric rings on dark spots (bullseye pattern) on older leaves.
prevention: Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or mancozeb.

Potato___Late_blight.name: Potato: Late Blight
Potato___Late_blight.description: A serious disease caused by *Phytophthora infestans*, showing water-soaked spots on leaves that turn brown/black with white mold on the underside.
prevention: Eliminate cull piles and volunteer potatoes.

Potato___healthy.name: Potato: Healthy
Potato___healthy.description: The potato plant leaves are green and free from spots or mold.
prevention: Monitor for pests like Colorado potato beetle.

Tomato_Bacterial_spot.name: Tomato: Bacterial Spot
Tomato_Bacterial_spot.description: Caused by *Xanthomonas* bacteria, causing small, water-soaked spots that become necrotic.

Tomato_Early_blight.name: Tomato: Early Blight
Tomato_Early_blight.description: Fungal disease causing concentric ring spots on lower leaves, yellowing, and defoliation.
prevention: Mulch around the base to prevent soil splash.

Tomato_Late_blight.name: Tomato: Late Blight
Tomato_Late_blight.description: Aggressive disease causing large, dark, water-soaked patches on leaves and fruit, often with white fungal growth.

Tomato_Leaf_Mold.name: Tomato: Leaf Mold
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.description: Fungal disease appearing as yellow spots on upper leaf surface and olive-green mold on the underside. Common in humid tunnels.
prevention: Remove lower leaves to improve air circulation.

Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.name: Tomato: Septoria Leaf Spot
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.description: Fungal disease causing many small, circular spots with dark borders and gray centers.
prevention: Clean up garden debris in fall.

Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.name: Tomato: Two-spotted Spider Mite
Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.description: Tiny pests that cause yellow stippling on leaves. Fine webbing may be visible.
prevention: Spray with water to dislodge mites.
Use insecticidal soap or neem oil.

Tomato__Target_Spot.name: Tomato: Target Spot
Tomato__Target_Spot.description: Fungal disease causing brown spots with concentric rings, similar to Early Blight but often on fruit too.

Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.name: Tomato: Yellow Leaf Curl Virus
Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.description: Viral disease transmitted by whiteflies. Leaves curl upward, turn yellow, and plants are stunted.
prevention: Control whiteflies using screens or insecticides.

Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.name: Tomato: Mosaic Virus
Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.description: Viral disease causing mottled (mosaic) light and dark green patterns on leaves.
prevention: Wash hands and tools often (tobacco users especially).

Tomato_healthy.name: Tomato: Healthy
Tomato_healthy.description: The tomato plant appears vigorous and free of disease symptoms.
